title: Lynda - Creating and Using Textures for Design with Von Glitschk
description:
Lynda.com - Creating and Using Textures for Design | Genre: e-Learning

For all the benefits computers provide, the designs that result from an all-digital workflow can come off as too clean and too cold. By reintroducing natural elements in your artwork, you can bring back an authentic and tactile visual quality. In this course, Von Glitschka shows how to collect and enhance real-world textures and integrate them into your digital designs. Great texture is all around; Von will teach you how to hunt for it, in nature and in places as unlikely as a parking lot. Once you've captured your textures, he'll show you how to convert them into formats suitable for a digital workflow, and put them to use in assorted Photoshop and Illustrator designs

Topics include:
* Photographing real-world surface textures
* Importing texture photographs with Adobe Bridge
* Organizing a library of textures
* Building a PSD texture resource file
* Creating wood-grain and painterly textures
* Using a Photoshop texture brush
* Using textures in Illustrator

Author: Von Glitschka
Subject: Design, Illustration, Design Techniques, Design Skills
Software: Illustrator CC
Level: Beginner
Duration: 4h 8m
Released: Dec 03, 2014
